required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Ipatasertib or Apitolisib With Abiraterone Acetate Versus Coralie in Participants With Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer Previously Treated With Docetaxel Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib/II Study of Ipatasertib (GDC-0068) or Apitolisib (GDC-0980) With Abiraterone Acetate Versus Abiraterone Acetate in Patients With Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer Previously Treated With Docetaxel-Based Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, international, Phase Ib/II trial consists of two stages: a Phase Ib, open-label stage in which the recommended Phase II dose will be determined for ipatasertib and apitolisib in combination with abiraterone and prednisone/prednisolone and a Phase II, 3-arm, double-blind, randomized comparison of ipatasertib with abiraterone and prednisone/prednisolone versus placebo with abiraterone and prednisone/prednisolone.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Percentage of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLTs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1 to 28 of Cycle 1 (Cycle length = 28 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Percentage of Participants by Nature of DLTs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1 to 28 of Cycle 1 (Cycle length = 28 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Recommended Phase II Dose (RP2D) of Ipatasertib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1 to 28 of Cycle 1 (Cycle length = 28 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Radiographic Progression (as Assessed by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors [RECIST] 1.1) or Death - Intent to Treat (ITT) Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurs first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter, and at treatment completion [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Radiographic Progression Free Survival as Assessed by RECIST 1.1 - ITT Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurs first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter, and at treatment completion [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Radiographic Progression (as Assessed by RECIST 1.1) or Death in Participants With Institute of Cancer Research (ICR) Phosphatase and Tensin Homolog (PTEN) Loss
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurs first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter, and at treatment completion [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Radiographic Progression Free Survival (as Assessed by RECIST 1.1) in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurs first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter, and at treatment completion [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants Who Died - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to death (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Overall Survival - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to death (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants Who Died in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to death (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Overall Survival in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to death (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA) Progression (as Assessed by Prostate Cancer Working Group 2 Criteria) - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to PSA progression (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Time to PSA Progression (as Assessed by Prostate Cancer Working Group 2 Criteria) - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to PSA progression (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With PSA Progression (as Assessed by Prostate Cancer Working Group 2 Criteria) in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to PSA progression (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Time to PSA Progression (as Assessed by Prostate Cancer Working Group 2 Criteria) in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to PSA progression (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With PSA Response - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 of every cycle (starting from Cycle 2) till 30 days after last dose (up to overall 3.6 years) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With PSA Response in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 of every cycle (starting from Cycle 2) till 30 days after last dose (up to overall 3.6 years) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response as Assessed by RECIST 1.1 - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurred first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (as Assessed by RECIST 1.1) in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurred first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Duration of Tumor Response, as Assessed by RECIST 1.1 - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to radiographic progression or death, whichever occurred first (assessed at screening, after Cycles 3, 5, 7, 9, every three cycles [12 weeks] thereafter up to end of treatment [up to 3.6 years overall]) (cycle length = 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Circulating Tumor Cells (CTC) Reduction Response - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, on Day 1 of Cycle 2, on Day 1 of Cycle 3, and at the treatment completion visit (up to overall 3.6 years) (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With CTC Reduction Response in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, on Day 1 of Cycle 2, on Day 1 of Cycle 3, and at the treatment completion visit (up to overall 3.6 years) (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With CTC Conversion - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, on Day 1 of Cycle 2, on Day 1 of Cycle 3, and at the treatment completion visit (up to overall 3.6 years) (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With CTC Conversion in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, on Day 1 of Cycle 2, on Day 1 of Cycle 3, and at the treatment completion visit (up to overall 3.6 years) (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Pain Progression - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day 1 of each cycle (cycle length=28 days) up to treatment completion (up to 3.6 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Time to Pain Progression - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day 1 of each cycle (cycle length=28 days) up to treatment completion (up to 3.6 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Percentage of Participants With Pain Progression in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day 1 of each cycle (cycle length=28 days) up to treatment completion (up to 3.6 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Time to Pain Progression in Participants With ICR PTEN Loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day 1 of each cycle (cycle length=28 days) up to treatment completion (up to 3.6 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) (in nanograms per milliliter [ng/mL]) of Ipatasertib and Apitolisib When Co-Administered With Abiraterone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Time to Cmax (tmax) (in hours) of Ipatasertib and Apitolisib When Co-Administered With Abiraterone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Area Under The Concentration Time Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours (AUC0-24) (in ng/mL*hours) of Ipatasertib and Apitolisib When Co-Administered With Abiraterone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Total Body Clearance (CL/F) of Ipatasertib When Co-Administered With Abiraterone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Day 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Accumulation Ratio of Ipatasertib When Co-Administered With Abiraterone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax of G-037720 (Metabolite of Ipatasertib)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: tmax of G-037720 (Metabolite of Ipatasertib)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: AUC0-24 of G-037720 (Metabolite of Ipatasertib)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Accumulation Ratio of G-037720 (Metabolite of Ipatasertib)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Cmax of Abiraterone When Co-Administered With Ipatasertib or Apitolisib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: tmax of Abiraterone When Co-Administered With Ipatasertib or Apitolisib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: AUC0-24 of Abiraterone When Co-Administered With Ipatasertib or Apitolisib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Plasma Half-Life of Abiraterone When Co-Administered With Ipatasertib or Apitolisib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Accumulation Ratio of Abiraterone When Co-Administered With Ipatasertib or Apitolisib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 24 hours post dose on Days 1, 15 of Cycle 1 (cycle length=28 days)

arm_group.description: Participants will receive ipatasertib 400 mg once daily, abiraterone 1000 mg once daily, and prednisone/prednisolone 5 mg twice daily (bid) continuously in 28-day treatment cycles until disease progression or intolerable toxicity.

Participants will receive apitolisib 30 mg once daily, abiraterone 1000 mg once daily, and prednisone/prednisolone 5 mg twice daily (bid) continuously in 28-day treatment cycles until disease progression or intolerable toxicity.

Participants will receive Ipatasertib 400 mg once daily, abiraterone 1000 mg once daily, and prednisone/prednisolone 5 mg bid continuously in 28-day treatment cycles until disease progression or intolerable toxicity.

Participants will receive Ipatasertib 200 mg once daily, abiraterone 1000 mg once daily, and prednisone/prednisolone 5 mg bid continuously in 28-day treatment cycles until disease progression or intolerable toxicity.

Participants will receive placebo (for Ipatasertib) once daily, abiraterone 1000 mg once daily, and prednisone/prednisolone 5 mg bid continuously in 28-day treatment cycles until disease progression or intolerable toxicity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed metastatic or advanced prostate adenocarcinoma that has been previously treated with docetaxel-based therapy and has progressed during treatment of at least one hormonal therapy
- Two rising PSA levels greater than or equal to (>/=) 2 ng/mL measured >/= 1 week apart or radiographic evidence of disease progression in soft tissue or bone
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1 at screening
- Adequate hematologic and organ function
- Documented willingness to use an effective means of contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of Type I or Type II diabetes mellitus requiring insulin
- New York Heart Association Class III or IV heart failure or Left ventricular ejection fraction < 50% or ventricular arrhythmia requiring medication
- Significant atherosclerotic disease, as evidenced by: unstable angina, history of myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to Day 1, or cerebrovascular accident within 6 months prior to Day 1
- Active autoimmune disease that is not controlled by nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs or active inflammatory disease which requires immunosuppressive therapy
- Clinically significant history of liver disease
- History of adrenal insufficiency or hyperaldosteronism
- Phase II only: Previous therapy for prostate cancer with 17 alpha-hydroxylase/C17,20-lyase inhibitors, including abiraterone
- Phase II only: Previous treatment for prostate cancer with Protein kinase B phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase and/or mammalian target of rapamycin inhibitors
- Need for chronic corticosteroid therapy of >/= 20 mg of prednisone per day or an equivalent dose of other anti inflammatory corticosteroids or immunosuppressant
